page.title: 07HITCHIN BY-PASS (1)
page.content: Hitchin Priory By_pass, sometimes called Tilehouse St. Relief road, was opened to the public on Monday December 7th 1981 at a cost of around Â£2.5m. Work continued on the roundabout at Tilehouse St., which was finally opened to traffic on Wednesday 7th April 1982. The By_pass is just over half a mile long and skirts the W.part of the town.It was designed to relieve traffic congestion in the centre of Hitchin particularly in the Tilehouse and Bridge St. areas where it was believed traffic was damaging several historical buildings. Tilehouse St. is Hitchin's oldest St. and has been for centuries the resi_ dence of the town's leading people. It was also thought that with a By_pass built the old centre of medieval Hitchin could once again become an attractive area.
